etymology.description: Pictogram (象形) – a deer-like mythical beast; compare 鹿.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a horned, deer-like creature in early script, emphasizing its cervine form. The resemblance to 鹿 ties its meaning to antelopes or mythic deer-beasts.

examples.chinese: 传说中的廌能辨是非(傳說中的廌能辨是非)。
examples.pinyin: Chuánshuō zhōng de zhì néng biàn shì-fēi.
examples.english: In legend, the zhì can distinguish right from wrong.

examples.chinese: 古文记载它像羚羊(古文記載它像羚羊)，额上生角(額上生角)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔwén jìzǎi tā xiàng língyáng, é shàng shēng jiǎo.
examples.english: Ancient texts record that it resembles an antelope, with a horn on its forehead.

examples.chinese: 在典籍里(在典籍裡)，廌常被称为神兽(廌常被稱為神獸)。
examples.pinyin: Zài diǎnjí lǐ, zhì cháng bèi chēng wéi shénshòu.
examples.english: In classical writings, zhì is often called a divine beast.
